intro: Sphingium lampolobum, commonly known as the yellow lantana, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands and moist soils, often forming dense stands. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its stems are square in cross-section. Sphingium lampolobum is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for wildlife.
